title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 09 December 2013 - XWiki
content:
<abusenius> has quit  
00:03 <sburjan`> has quit  
00:15 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
00:17 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
00:17 <vmassol> has quit  
00:21 <vmassol1> has quit

08:16 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:32 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:57 <j-simard> has joined #xwiki  
09:01 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:05 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:10 <sdumitriu> has quit  
09:11 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
09:30 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:32 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:48 <Kaisen> has joined #xwiki  
09:50 <Kaisen> Good morning. I have upgrade today my xwiki from 5.2.1 to 5.2.2 but now I'm faceing some performance problems. If I go from a page back to the main webhome it takes around 30sec until it shows up. Before it was like 2-3sec. Is there a log or anything where I can check where the problem is comming from?  
09:50 <vmassol> good morning everyone  
09:51 <vmassol> reminder: 5.3 final release is planned for tomorrow  
09:51 <vmassol> does anyone have anything to commit before tomorrow?  
09:52 <vmassol> Kaisen: did you change your DB?  
09:52 <vmassol> (like for ex remove some indexes)  
09:52 <Kaisen> no I just do the upgrade over apt-get upgrade and than with DW  
09:53 <Kaisen> Don't touch the database  
09:53 <vmassol> the only reason I know for the home page to be slow is missing indexes in the DB on the Activity Stream table  
09:53 <vmassol> you could try removing the AS widget and see if the page load is still slow  
09:57 <Kaisen> Yes your right, as soon as I remove the AS it is fast like before  
09:58 <vmassol> Kaisen: so make sure you have the proper indexes on the AS table  
09:58 <vmassol> seehttp://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Performances  
09:58 <vmassol> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Performances  
09:58 <vmassol> specifcally: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Performances#HDatabaseIndexes  
10:01 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:09 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
10:09 <Kaisen> Thanks for the help. I run the indexexs part but it is still slow. Does the sanity script help at this point or does it only checks the consistency of DB  
10:13 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <evalica> has quit  
10:13 <evalica1> is now known as <evalica>  
10:18 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
10:18 <evalica> has quit  
10:29 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:30 <strivf> has joined #xwiki  
10:34 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
10:42 <vmassol> Denis: check my comment on XWIKI-9782 :)  
10:42 <vmassol> good morning btw!  
10:43 <vmassol> Kaisen: btw I should have mentioned that there's an admin app to check and set the indexes  
10:43 <vmassol> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Admin+Tools+Application  
10:43 <vmassol> (and for checking other things)  
10:44 <Kaisen> Ok I will try  
10:53 <Kaisen> I don't know why, but I run mysqloptimize for the xwiki database and now it is fast again. I also installed the Admin extension. This is realy greate thanks for the tip !  
10:57 <vmassol> oh cool  
11:00 <evalica1> has quit  
11:05 <mflorea> vmassol: yes, I have something to commit on Solr.  
11:05 <vmassol> to answer my own question, I still have http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XCOMMONS-497 but it depends on HC  
11:05 <vmassol> Scott is supposed to release today or tommorrow  
11:15 <strivf> has quit  
11:15 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:17 <vmassol> ok so here's the status=  
11:17 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9479?filter=12398&jql=Project%20in%20(%22XWiki%20Commons%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Rendering%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Platform%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Enterprise%22)%20AND%20fixVersion%20in%20(%225.3-milestone-1%22%2C%20%225.3-milestone-2%22%2C%20%225.3-rc-1%22%2C%20%225.3%22)%20AND%20resolution%20in%20(Unresolved)  
11:17 <vmassol> please everyone make sure you have your issue planned assigned and with a fixfor of 5.3  
11:17 <vmassol> gdelhumeau for ex, I don't see any for you, it means you're clear?  
11:17 <vmassol> :)  
11:18 <vmassol> (nothing to fix?)  
11:18 <gdelhumeau> nothng to fix until we found something  
11:18 <gdelhumeau> I am working on http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9774  
11:19 <gdelhumeau> I don't know if it SHOULD be in 5.3  
11:19 <vmassol> probably not  
11:19 <vmassol> seems better for 5.4M1  
11:19 <vmassol> at this stage we should only important bug fixes  
11:19 <vmassol> \*only have  
11:19 <Kaisen> @vmassol one more question for you :) the XWiki Configuration Check tells me that UTF-8 encoding is not set properly - In the list only     XWiki Configuration tells XWiki encoding: null  
11:20 <vmassol> Kaisen: see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Encoding  
11:20 <Kaisen> But if i check the xwiki.cfg encodig is set to xwiki.encoding = UTF-8  
11:20 <vmassol> Kaisen: check the doc, you'lls ee there are several places  
11:21 <Kaisen> I check all the points and everything is set up right (beside Mysql) if I add there the default set the server doesn't start  
11:26 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
11:26 <evalica> has quit  
11:55 <camil7> has joined #xwiki  
12:08 <evalica1> has quit  
12:36 <Kaisen> Just for info. The param default-character-set=utf8 is not supported in MySQL 5.5 which ends up that the server doesn'T start  
12:37 <Kaisen> Should be fine with character-set-server = utf8 and collation-server = utf8\_bin  
12:46 <vmassol> Kaisen: maybe you could comment on the page or edit it to mention this?  
12:52 <Kaisen> If I register - I'm able to do?  
12:52 <vmassol> yes  
12:52 <Kaisen> Great  
13:05 <vmassol> thanks Kaisen  
13:06 <Kaisen> np - but still I have the problem that the Admin pack says that xwiki is not running in UTF-8 and I don't know where to checke anymore :(  
13:08 <vmassol> Kaisen: you could check the admin tool app itself  
13:08 <vmassol> edit its page to check where it checks ;)  
13:14 <vrachieru> has joined #xwiki  
13:21 <vmassol> vrachieru: nice extensions and nice documentation :)  
13:44 <vmassol> has quit  
13:45 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
13:54 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
14:00 <Jigar54> has joined #xwiki  
14:01 <Jigar54> i downloaded xwiki from the link you had given me...but it has some files inn unreadable formats  
14:23 <ekarlso-> has quit  
14:23 <ekarlso> has joined #xwiki  
14:33 <ajp> has joined #xwiki  
14:47 <gdelhumeau> Can someone install http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Presentation+Application on platform.xwiki.org?  
14:55 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: done  
14:56 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
14:57 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: thx!!  
14:58 <gdelhumeau> does http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/XWikiVelocityTraining?skin=Presentation.PresentationSkin#1 work for you?  
14:58 <gdelhumeau> I can't navigate through the slides  
14:59 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
15:00 <tmortagne> no arraws  
15:00 <tmortagne> arrows  
15:00 <tmortagne> looks like empty presentation  
15:01 <OSIMasson> any enterprise hosting users lose their skins?  
15:02 <vmassol> OSIMasson: hi, I see a skin at http://wiki.opensource.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome  
15:02 <vmassol> what did you loose?  
15:03 <OSIMasson> vmassol: we lost our logo and bkgrounds  
15:04 <OSIMasson> vmassol: looks like just the header related changes  
15:04 <vmassol> I'd check the diff on the page that contains the change  
15:05 <OSIMasson> vmassol: the other changes are still there  
15:05 <vmassol> where did you set the logo?  
15:10 <OSIMasson> vmassol: http://wiki.opensource.org/xwiki/bin/view/ColorThemes/Mint#Attachments  
15:10 <vmassol> OSIMasson: I'm logging on  there to check  
15:11 <vmassol> I see version 14.1: "Upload new image header.png"  
15:11 <Jigar54> is now known as <Jigar\_\_>  
15:12 <vmassol> you just rolled back right?  
15:16 <vmassol> OSIMasson: seems Guillaume Fenollar is also trying to help you at the same time, I've asked him to join us here  
15:16 <OSIMasson> vmassol: I did not rollback  
15:17 <Jigar\_\_> has quit  
15:17 <OSIMasson> vmassol: I am looking at the history on http://wiki.opensource.org/xwiki/bin/view/ColorThemes/Mint#Attachments  
15:17 <GuillaumeF> has joined #xwiki  
15:17 <vmassol> OSIMasson: me too  
15:17 <vmassol> I was surprisd to see a rollback by user XWikiAdmin  
15:17 <OSIMasson> GuillaumeF: hey, thanks for helping  
15:17 <vmassol> since it wasn't me  
15:17 <camil7> I guess the upgrader uploads new attachments on every upgrade  
15:17 <GuillaumeF> Hello  
15:18 <OSIMasson> vmassol: maybe the upgrade?  
15:18 <GuillaumeF> Here the content of the mail I was about to send:  
15:18 <GuillaumeF> I can see that some elements of the color theme (logo, header) have been replaced when you updated the pages, after 5.2.2 upgrade, last friday.Look http://wiki.opensource.org/xwiki/bin/viewattachrev/ColorThemes/Mint/logo.pngYou can see that the logo has been replaced by the defaut XWiki one.  
15:18 <GuillaumeF> I'll rollback history  
15:18 <vmassol> OSIMasson: no I think GuillaumeF did it  
15:18 <OSIMasson> vmassol: 5.2.2  
15:18 <GuillaumeF> of course, IRC doesn't permit me to send the whole mail. Great  
15:18 <vmassol> GuillaumeF: you lost several changes I think, you didn't just roll back one back  
15:18 <tmortagne> would be better to avoid modifying standard color theme  
15:18 <vmassol> s/one back/one change  
15:19 <camil7> that is probably XWIKI-9120  
15:19 <tmortagne> you should copy it and modify the new one  
15:19 <GuillaumeF> what? No, I only rollback document's version to before the distribution wizard update  
15:19 <vmassol> I doubt it  
15:19 <vmassol> you rolled back to 13.1  
15:19 <vmassol> and between last and 13.1 there were 10 changes  
15:19 <vmassol> AFAIK the DW only does 1 version change  
15:20 <GuillaumeF> oh, it was minor edits  
15:20 <tmortagne> the DW does not do only one version change  
15:20 <tmortagne> each attachment has its separate save  
15:21 <vmassol> tmortagne: does it add a specific summary that we can recognize?  
15:21 <vmassol> ATM there are none I can see  
15:21 <vmassol> http://wiki.opensource.org/xwiki/bin/view/ColorThemes/Mint?viewer=history&showminor=true  
15:21 <vmassol> so I don't think the DW made any change at all  
15:21 <vmassol> right tmortagne?  
15:22 <tmortagne> EM use "Import: add attachment" for attachments  
15:23 <vmassol> that's what I thought, so you agree EM didn't do anything on this page?  
15:23 <vmassol> (it shouldn't anyway since it hasn't change between 5.2.1 and 5.2.2)  
15:23 <vmassol> \*changed  
15:24 <tmortagne> I see "Import: add attachment" in 14.10  
15:24 <vmassol> ah yes, my eyes are not working today  
15:25 <tmortagne> EM does not compare attachment yet, it always get the new ones  
15:25 <vmassol> I still don't understand why EM made any change to this page  
15:26 <tmortagne> (03:25:00 PM) tmortagne: EM does not compare attachment yet, it always get the new ones  
15:27 <vmassol> that's a huge bug  
15:27 <vmassol> :(  
15:27 <vmassol> (if I understand correctly)  
15:27 <tmortagne> it's a limitation  
15:27 <vmassol> more than that  
15:27 <vmassol> look at this example  
15:27 <vmassol> it means people loose their content  
15:28 <tmortagne> this example is far from right, a standard color theme should not be modified  
15:28 <vmassol> I don't agree  
15:28 <vmassol> where is this written?  
15:28 <vmassol> how can a user guess this stupid rule?  
15:28 <vmassol> is he prevented from editing?  
15:29 <tmortagne> and it's not lost it's in the history  
15:29 <vmassol> eah sure  
15:29 <vmassol> you're right  
15:29 <vmassol> that's why patrick is asking us why  
15:29 <vmassol> it's so obvious  
15:29 <vmassol> :)  
15:29 <OSIMasson> I'm just (trying to) follow along  
15:29 <vmassol> OSIMasson: we have a bug (which thomas calls limitatoin)  
15:30 <OSIMasson> :)  
15:30 <vmassol> when you upgrade with the Distirbution Wizard  
15:30 <vmassol> if you modify a page coming from our default distributon (an existing page)  
15:30 <vmassol> actually if you change an atatchment  
15:30 <OSIMasson> Although I am sure I could have pressed the wrong button  
15:31 <vmassol> and when you uprade there's the same attachment but with a newer date  
15:31 <vmassol> then your change gets overwritten  
15:31 <vmassol> so in this case you need to rollback to version 14.8  
15:31 <vmassol> can you do that?  
15:31 <OSIMasson> vmassol: me?  
15:31 <vmassol> I can do it for you if you want  
15:32 <vmassol> doing it  
15:32 <OSIMasson> I do not see 14.8  
15:32 <vmassol> done  
15:32 <OSIMasson> vmassol: 14.10  
15:32 <OSIMasson> thx  
15:32 <vmassol> it's a minor edit  
15:33 <vmassol> so I rolled back to just before the DW made any change to this page  
15:34 <OSIMasson> vmassol: THANKS  
15:35 <vmassol> is all ok now?  
15:55 <vmassol> tmortagne: do we have a jira issue for this already?  
15:55 <vmassol> is it http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9120 ?  
15:55 <vmassol> yes seems o  
15:56 <vmassol> so  
15:56 <vmassol> tmortagne: do you agree that we should target this for 5.4?  
15:57 <tmortagne> vmassol: it's already fixed in one of my branches and will be part of 5.4  
15:57 <vmassol> ah rgeat  
15:57 <vmassol> putting a fix for of 5.4M1 ATM then  
15:57 <tmortagne> it required a big refactoring based on wikistream  
15:57 <tmortagne> which I started  
15:57 <vmassol> wiki stream is used by EM?  
15:58 <tmortagne> it will now  
15:58 <vmassol> ok  
15:58 <tmortagne> part of it at least  
15:58 <tmortagne> for now only the XAR module is reused directly  
15:58 <tmortagne> since there is no merge support in wikistream itself  
15:58 <tmortagne> maybe later  
16:07 <vmassol> tmortagne: does it generate a conflict for 9120?  
16:07 <tmortagne> no  
16:07 <vmassol> ok  
16:42 <cjd> Can I write an extension which depends on jar extensions in maven central ?  
16:42 <cjd> I can't remember if that was possible  
16:42 <sburjan> has quit  
16:43 <msmeria> has quit  
16:53 <tmortagne> cjd: yes you can  
16:57 <cjd> thanks  
16:58 <vmassol> releasing presentation application 1.3  
17:01 <vmassol> sdumitriu: ping  
17:02 <vmassol> sdumitriu: I see you did this: " Updated the parent to 5.2" for the presentation application. This doesn't look good since it prevents older xwiki installs from using it. Is there any good reason you did this?  
17:02 <vmassol> doesn't it work with older version?  
17:15 <evalica> has quit  
17:22 <sdumitriu> vmassol: It should work, I just updated since it was on a very old RC version, and I wanted to have the checkstyle enabled in the build  
17:22 <vmassol> sdumitriu: ok released 1.3 with a parent 3.3-rc-1  
17:23 <eastman> has joined #xwiki  
17:24 <sdumitriu> vmassol: You could have left it at 3.3 at least  
17:24 <sdumitriu> But that's fine  
17:24 <vmassol> yes I thought about it  
17:24 <vmassol> but in the end I preferred to leave what was there before  
17:24 <vmassol> doesn't really hurt  
17:24 <vmassol> we can change that later if we want
